ruleset.name: Apex Code Style Rules
ruleset.description: Custom rules for Apex code style and formatting

rule.name: MultipleStringContainsCalls
rule.message: Multiple String.contains() calls (at least {0}) in a conditional should be replaced with a single regex pattern for better performance and maintainability
rule.description:
Multiple String.contains() calls in conditionals should be replaced with a single regex pattern for better performance and maintainability. This rule detects when there are a minimum number of contains() calls in a conditional expression.
To customize this rule, edit the $minCalls variable at the beginning of the XPath expression (default: 2). This sets the minimum number of contains() calls required in a conditional before a regex pattern is recommended.
